result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Carlos E Boyer in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana notes matters are resolved and parties will enter a plea today w/a request for a PSI.  State agrees and states agreement as far as it goes.  Atty Masana enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  PSI ordered.  To be completed no later than 12/27/2016.  Bond continued.

15CF95

Ct 2:  Dismissed

15CF426 is dismissed/read-in  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Carlos E Boyer in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved.  Set for plea hearing on 10/12 @ 10 am Br. 2.
Jury trial on October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Atty Masana acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Court enters Not Guilty pleas - Set for Trial.  Bond continues.  15CF95 will go back on the JT calendar, as will 15CF426, although they will be placed in different branches.

Defendant Carlos E Boyer in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes DE will waive prelim today.  Atty Masana agrees.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Carlos E Boyer in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE was previously represented by Atty. Frank.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Time limits continued waived.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return date on June 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Carlos E Boyer in court.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/intern Cody McConnell.  State states case and appearances as well as status.  DE told him that he has requested new counsel from PD's office but they didn't have a new attorney appointed for him yet.  State is requesting PTC/RD be set and time limits be considered waived due to counsel issues.  DE is in agreement with waiver of time limits.  Court questions/accepts time limit waiver.  Set for PTC/RD.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
